column4: i get lots of this guys "hub 2-1:1.0: over-current condition on port 5
often caused by buggy usb2 drivers... best of luck.
does a module get loaded that makes them work?  perhaps you need to tell the system to manually load that module on boot?  just guessing.
i doubt that's the module name!
does "lsusb" from terminal show you?
have you searched with that PL2303?
no, like online.
hardy isn't exactly current information!
stop

you can more-or-less ignore the "hub 2-1:1.0: over-current condition" if you want!  i've had to rebuild kernels on people's computer to get rid of it - it involved removing the usb2 driver, even though i'd "guess" usb2 worked beforehand.
c++ chat is OT here.
http://koti.mbnet.fi/lonnberg/pl2303x.html
it "might" be.  BUT - i HIGHLY recommend against trying to custom compile your kernel!
i'm guessing that's for a 2.6 kernel anyways!  outdated for sure.
i'd save lsmod's output when it's NOT working, then save lsmod's output when it IS working - is there any difference?  if so, tell ubuntu to lead that additional module on boot.
s/lead/load/
whats this ?s/lead/load/
correction using regular expression in previous statement SUBSTITUTE/THIS/THAT/
thats working lsmod http://pastebin.com/1XR3JZ6z
FYI i don't go to pastebin.com (if you want me to read your pastes, please switch to a non-advertising/non-tracking site, like paste.ubuntu.com or not... up to you)
but just look yourself - is there any difference?
so you need to add that to boot (don't ask me - someone else should know)
letme check
